modules.name: Commitment
modules.description: Tracks when entities agree to do something and must follow through or face penalties.

modules.name: Negotiation
modules.description: Handles back-and-forth agreements between entities (trade offers, alliance terms, contract negotiations).

modules.name: Validation
modules.description: Checks if any action in the game is allowed based on all current rules and states.

modules.name: Permission
modules.description: Manages who can do what actions (role-based access, level requirements, unlock systems).

modules.name: Restriction
modules.description: Tracks what entities are currently blocked from doing (temporary bans, commitment restrictions, debuffs).

modules.name: Progression
modules.description: Handles all forms of advancement (experience, levels, skill trees, mastery, prestige).

modules.name: Economy
modules.description: Manages all currencies and economic transactions (gold, gems, tokens, market prices).

modules.name: Inventory
modules.description: Handles item storage, management, and capacity (bags, banks, shared storage).

modules.name: Combat
modules.description: Processes all combat calculations (damage, healing, mitigation, combat states).

modules.name: Movement
modules.description: Controls entity movement and physics (walking, flying, teleporting, collision).

modules.name: Social
modules.description: Manages relationships between entities (friends, enemies, blocks, marriages).

modules.name: Communication
modules.description: Handles all messaging systems (chat, mail, voice, emotes, pings).

modules.name: Guild
modules.description: Everything related to guild management (ranks, permissions, banks, progression).

modules.name: Party
modules.description: Small group formation and management (party creation, loot rules, roles).

modules.name: Raid
modules.description: Large group content management (raid formation, assignments, lockouts).

modules.name: Alliance
modules.description: Multi-guild cooperation systems (alliance wars, shared resources, politics).

modules.name: Matchmaking
modules.description: Finds and creates matches for entities (ranked, casual, custom games).

modules.name: Queue
modules.description: Manages all waiting systems (dungeon queue, battleground queue, login queue).

modules.name: Instance
modules.description: Creates and manages instanced content (dungeons, raids, personal instances).

modules.name: World
modules.description: Manages the persistent game world (zones, weather, day/night, world events).

modules.name: Event
modules.description: Handles all game events (seasonal events, world bosses, dynamic events).

modules.name: Quest
modules.description: Traditional quest systems (quest chains, daily quests, story quests).

modules.name: Achievement
modules.description: Tracks and awards achievements (account-wide, character-specific, hidden).

modules.name: Collection
modules.description: Manages collectibles (mounts, pets, toys, appearances, cards).

modules.name: Crafting
modules.description:
All item creation

modules.name: Commitment
modules.description:
When an entity promises to do something, they're locked into completing it. No backing out without consequences.

**What it tracks:**

- Who committed to what
- What they can't do until it's complete
properties: What they can't do until it's complete

modules.name: Negotiation
modules.description:
Back-and-forth bargaining between entities. Not instant - requires multiple steps.

**What it handles:**

- Opening negotiations
- Counter-offers
- Stalling tactics
- Final agreements
- Breaking off t

modules.name: Offer
modules.description:
One-time proposals from one entity to another. Different from negotiation - this is take it or leave it.

**What it manages:**

- Creating offers
- Expiration times
- Acceptance conditions
- Withdrawa

modules.name: Sacrifice
modules.description:
Giving up something permanently for a benefit. Can't be undone.

**Types of sacrifices:**

- Items destroyed forever
- Stats permanently reduced
- Abilities locked away
- Progress reset
- Relationship

modules.name: Secret
modules.description:
Information that's hidden from some entities but known to others.

**What it tracks:**

- Who knows what secrets
- How secrets spread
- Conditions for revelation
- Consequences of exposure
- Secret ex

modules.name: Hint
modules.description:
Partial information given to guide without revealing everything.

**How hints work:**

- Progressive revelation (hints get clearer)
- Contextual hints (based on what you're doing)
- Misleading hints (
properties: Contextual hints (based on what you're doing)

modules.name: Mislead
modules.description:
Intentionally wrong information to trick entities.

**Misleading mechanics:**

- False information that seems real
- Partial truths mixed with lies
- Misdirection targets
- Discovery mechanics (findin
properties: Discovery mechanics (finding out you were misled)

modules.name: Hide
modules.description:
Making things invisible or undetectable.

**What can be hidden:**

- Physical presence
- Information/stats
- Intentions
- Resources
- Alliances
- True identity

**Example:** Guild hides their real arm

modules.name: Crawl
modules.description:
Slowest movement. Used for stealth or when injured.

**When crawling happens:**
- Health below threshold
- Stealth requirements
- Terrain forcing crawl
- Carrying too much
- Specific areas requiring i

modules.name: Walk
modules.description:
Standard movement. Default state.

**Walking mechanics:**
- Base movement speed
- No stamina drain
- Normal detection radius
- Can perform most actions
- Standard terrain interaction

modules.name: Run
modules.description:
Faster movement with costs.

**Running mechanics:**
- 200% walk speed
- Drains stamina
- Easier to detect
- Limited actions while running
- Terrain affects run speed
- Can't run forever

## How These

modules.name: Betray
modules.description: Breaking alliances and trust

modules.name: Reveal
modules.description: Exposing secrets and hidden information

modules.name: Bluff
modules.description: Pretending to have something you don't

modules.name: Spy
modules.description: Gathering information without being detected

modules.name: Sabotage
modules.description: Secretly damaging others' progress

modules.name: Disguise
modules.description: Appearing as something you're not

modules.name: Track
modules.description: Following other entities' movements

modules.name: Escape
modules.description: Getting out of commitments/traps

modules.name: Trap
modules.description:
Setting up situations for others to fall into

## Module Configuration

Each module can be configured with:

**Entities:** Who can use this module (players, NPCs, guilds, etc.)

**Conditions:** When t

modules.name: Rumor
modules.description:
Rumors spread and mutate as they pass between people. Each retelling changes them.

**How rumors work:**
- Start with original truth
- Each person who passes it changes it slightly
- After 10 people,
properties: Each person who passes it changes it slightly
After 10 people, might be completely different

modules.name: Gossip
modules.description:
Personal information spreading through social networks. More targeted than rumors.

**Gossip mechanics:**

- Travels through friend networks
- Faster spread than rumors
- More believable from trusted

modules.name: Whisper
modules.description:
Direct, secret communication between two people. Can be overheard.

**Whisper features:**
- Only sender and receiver know (usually)
- Can be intercepted if someone is listening
- Leaves no permanent r
properties: Can be intercepted if someone is listening

modules.name: Tale
modules.description:
Stories that grow with each telling. Become legends over time.

**Tale evolution:**
- Start as simple events
- Each retelling adds details
- Eventually become folklore
- Can become completely fictiona

modules.name: Folklore
modules.description:
Established stories that affect how people behave. Like game-wide beliefs.

**Folklore effects:**

- "Never go to the woods at midnight" (people actually avoid it)
- "The red door brings luck" (people
properties: "Never go to the woods at midnight" (people actually avoid it)
"The red door brings luck" (people seek it)
Can be proven false but still believed

modules.name: Curse
modules.description:
Negative chains that must be passed on or suffered through.

**Curse mechanics:**
- Received from someone else
- Must complete task or pass it on
- Gets worse if held too long
- Can return to sender i
properties: Must complete task or pass it on
Gets worse if held too long
Can return to sender if conditions met
Some curses can split to multiple people
Breaking curse might require group effort

modules.name: Blessing
modules.description:
Positive chains that can be shared but diminish.

**Blessing behavior:**
- Starts strong with first person
- Each sharing weakens it
- Can choose to keep or pass
- Some blessings multiply when shared
properties: Can choose to keep or pass
Some blessings multiply when shared correctly
Can turn to curse if hoarded

modules.name: Obligation
modules.description:
Debts and favors owed between entities. Creates long chains of "I owe you."

**Obligation chains:**
- A owes B, B owes C, C owes A (circular)
- Can trade obligations
- Can forgive debts
- Can call in
properties: A owes B, B owes C, C owes A (circular)

modules.name: Prophecy
modules.description:
Future predictions that influence present behavior.

**Prophecy mechanics:**
- Vague enough to interpret many ways
- Self-fulfilling or self-defeating
- Can be passed between people
- Belief affects o
properties: Vague enough to interpret many ways

modules.name: Warning
modules.description:
Urgent information that must be spread quickly or consequences occur.

**Warning systems:**
- Time-sensitive spread required
- Each person warned can warn others
- False warnings create distrust
- Ign
properties: Each person warned can warn others

modules.name: Errand
modules.description:
Simple tasks passed between people. "While you're there, could you..."

**Errand chains:**
- A asks B to do something
- B can delegate to C
- C might delegate to D
- Original requester might not know
properties: A asks B to do something
Original requester might not know who actually does it
Can be corrupted at each step

modules.name: Quest Chain
modules.description:
Multi-part tasks where each person does one part.

**Chain mechanics:**
- Person 1 gathers materials
- Person 2 crafts item
- Person 3 delivers it
- Person 4 uses it
- Break anywhere = entire chain fa

modules.name: Relay
modules.description:
Information or items that must pass through specific people in order.

**Relay rules:**
- Must go A→B→C→D, can't skip
- Each person can hold, modify, or pass
- Time limits at each step
- Can be interc
properties: Each person can hold, modify, or pass

modules.name: Burden
modules.description:
Tasks nobody wants but someone must do. Gets passed around.

**Burden behavior:**
- Penalty for holding too long
- Can trick others into taking it
- Can force onto someone weaker
- Eventually someone
properties: Can trick others into taking it

modules.name: Inheritance
modules.description:
Things passed down through death/leaving. Can be good or bad.

**Inheritance types:**
- Debts passed to children
- Curses through bloodlines
- Responsibilities to continue
- Secrets that must be kept

modules.name: Reputation
modules.description:
How actions affect standing with different groups.

**Reputation layers:**

- Personal reputation (what you did)
- Family reputation (what your family did)
- Association reputation (who you know)
- Hi
properties: Rumored reputation (what people think you did)

modules.name: Shame
modules.description:
Social punishment for breaking chains or failing tasks.

**Shame mechanics:**
- Public marking of failure
- Reduced social options
- NPCs treat you differently
- Can be redeemed through action
- Can b

modules.name: Honor
modules.description:
Social rewards for maintaining chains and completing obligations.

**Honor systems:**

- Builds slowly, lost quickly
- Opens special interactions
- Can be wagered/risked
- Family honor vs personal hon

modules.name: Trust
modules.description:
How much others believe you'll complete your part of chains.

**Trust mechanics:**

- Built through successful completions
- Lost through failures
- Can be manipulated through rumors
- Different trust
properties: Trust networks (if A trusts B, and B trusts C...)

modules.name: Betrayal
modules.description:
Breaking chains intentionally for personal gain.

**Betrayal consequences:**
- Immediate benefit
- Long-term reputation damage
- Creates vendetta chains
- Can trigger curse chains
- Sometimes necessar

modules.name: Secret
modules.description:
(Expanded)

Information with power that loses value if spread.

**Secret types:**

- Personal secrets (damages one person)
- Group secrets (damages organization)
- Power secrets (gives advantage)
- Da
properties: Dangerous secrets (knowing puts you at risk)
Time secrets (only valuable until certain time)

modules.name: Lie
modules.description:
False information knowingly spread.

**Lie mechanics:**
- Must remember what you told whom
- Can be caught through inconsistency
- Some lies become "truth" if believed enough
- Counter-lies to combat
properties: Must remember what you told whom
Some lies become "truth" if believed enough
Webs of lies that trap creator

modules.name: Truth
modules.description:
Verified information that can break rumors/lies.

**Truth power:**

- Hard to obtain
- Can destroy rumor chains
- Sometimes less believed than lies
- Can be twisted into new rumors
- Protected by thos
properties: Can be twisted into new rumors
Protected by those who benefit from lies

modules.name: Hint
modules.description:
(Expanded)

Partial information that guides without revealing.

**Hint types:**

- Breadcrumbs (following leads to truth)
- Red herrings (misleading hints)
- Riddles (must be interpreted)
- Warnings (

modules.name: Omen
modules.description:
Signs and portents that may or may not mean something.

**Omen interpretation:**

- Same omen means different things to different people
- Can create panic or confidence
- Stack to create patterns
- S
properties: Same omen means different things to different people

modules.name: Fetch
modules.description: Retrieve something and bring it back through chain.

modules.name: Deliver
modules.description: Take something through chain to destination.

modules.name: Gather
modules.description: Collect multiple things from multiple people.

modules.name: Spread
modules.description: Distribute something among many people.

modules.name: Find
modules.description: Locate something/someone lost.

modules.name: Hide
modules.description:
(Expanded)

Conceal something from discovery chains.

modules.name: Protect
modules.description: Guard something through time period.

modules.name: Destroy
modules.description: Eliminate something without being caught.

modules.name: Create
modules.description: Make something that requires multiple people.

modules.name: Transform
modules.description:
Change something through multiple steps.

## Time Pressure Modules

modules.name: Deadline
modules.description: Tasks that must complete by specific time or fail.

modules.name: Decay
modules.description: Things that get worse over time if not maintained.

modules.name: Urgency
modules.description: Tasks that become harder the longer you wait.

modules.name: Patience
modules.description: Tasks that require waiting specific periods.

modules.name: Timing
modules.description: Tasks that must be done at exact right moment.

modules.name: Sequence
modules.description: Things that must happen in specific order.

modules.name: Simultaneity
modules.description: Multiple things that must happen at same time.

modules.name: Rhythm
modules.description: Repeating patterns that must be maintained.

modules.name: Cycle
modules.description: Circular patterns that repeat.

modules.name: Season
modules.description:
Things that can only happen at certain times.

## Consequence Modules

modules.name: Ripple
modules.description: Small actions create expanding consequences.

modules.name: Avalanche
modules.description: Consequences that build exponentially.

modules.name: Echo
modules.description: Past actions return in unexpected ways.

modules.name: Karma
modules.description: What you do comes back to you.

modules.name: Vendetta
modules.description: Revenge chains that perpetuate.

modules.name: Haunt
modules.description: Past failures that follow you.

modules.name: Shadow
modules.description: Hidden consequences not immediately visible.

modules.name: Mirror
modules.description: What you do to others happens to you.

modules.name: Balance
modules.description: Universe forcing equilibrium.

modules.name: Price
modules.description:
Everything has a cost, paid eventually.

## Relationship Modules

modules.name: Bond
modules.description: Connections that strengthen or weaken.

modules.name: Rival
modules.description: Competitive relationships that drive action.

modules.name: Mentor
modules.description: Teaching relationships with obligations.

modules.name: Apprentice
modules.description: Learning relationships with duties.

modules.name: Blood
modules.description: Family connections that can't be broken.

modules.name: Oath
modules.description: Sworn promises with supernatural weight.

modules.name: Pact
modules.description: Agreements with severe consequences.

modules.name: Alliance
modules.description: Temporary cooperation with conditions.

modules.name: Feud
modules.description: Long-standing conflicts between groups.

modules.name: Romance
modules.description:
Emotional chains with special rules.

## Transformation Modules

modules.name: Corruption
modules.description: Gradual degradation through bad choices.

modules.name: Redemption
modules.description: Paths to restore lost honor/reputation.

modules.name: Evolution
modules.description: Things that change based on how they're used.

modules.name: Mutation
modules.description: Unexpected changes from combinations.

modules.name: Infection
modules.description: Spreading conditions through contact.

modules.name: Cure
modules.description: Removing negative conditions through chains.

modules.name: Awakening
modules.description: Dormant things activated by conditions.

modules.name: Seal
modules.description: Locking away power/danger.

modules.name: Release
modules.description: Freeing sealed things.

modules.name: Metamorphosis
modules.description:
Complete transformation at threshold.

## Resource Modules

modules.name: Scarcity
modules.description: Limited resources create competition.

modules.name: Abundance
modules.description: Excess that must be distributed.

modules.name: Trade
modules.description: Exchange networks between people.

modules.name: Debt
modules.description: Owed resources with interest.

modules.name: Investment
modules.description: Resources given expecting return.

modules.name: Theft
modules.description: Taking what isn't yours, creating chains.

modules.name: Gift
modules.description: Given freely but creates social obligation.

modules.name: Sacrifice
modules.description:
(Expanded)

Giving up something precious for greater good.

modules.name: Waste
modules.description: Resources lost through negligence.

modules.name: Hoard
modules.description:
Keeping too much creates problems.

## Mystery Modules

modules.name: Puzzle
modules.description: Problems requiring multiple people to solve.

modules.name: Riddle
modules.description: Questions with hidden answers.

modules.name: Mystery
modules.description: Unknown things that create speculation.

modules.name: Investigation
modules.description: Uncovering truth through questioning.

modules.name: Conspiracy
modules.description: Hidden groups working together.

modules.name: Revelation
modules.description: Truth exposed at critical moment.

modules.name: Disguise
modules.description: Hiding identity to accomplish goals.

modules.name: Unmask
modules.description: Revealing someone's true nature.

modules.name: Illusion
modules.description: False realities that affect behavior.

modules.name: Disillusion
modules.description:
Breaking false beliefs.

## Fairytale Modules

modules.name: Wish
modules.description: Desires that come true with twists.

modules.name: Quest
modules.description:
(Fairytale version)

Impossible tasks that test character.

modules.name: Trial
modules.description: Tests that reveal true nature.

modules.name: Transformation
modules.description:
(Fairytale)

People becoming animals/objects as punishment/reward.

modules.name: Moral
modules.description: Lessons learned through consequences.

modules.name: Magic
modules.description: Supernatural elements that follow rules.

modules.name: Trickster
modules.description: Entities that disrupt chains for chaos.

modules.name: Guardian
modules.description: Protectors of certain chains/paths.

modules.name: Threshold
modules.description: Points of no return in chains.

modules.name: Return
modules.description:
Coming back changed from journey.

## How These Create Chain Reactions

**Example Chain:**
1. Someone starts a RUMOR about treasure (Rumor Module)
2. You hear it as GOSSIP from a friend (Gossip Module

modules.name: Bet
modules.description:
Wagering on outcomes of other people's actions or chain results.

- Bet on whether someone completes their task
- Bet on how rumors will spread
- Bet on which version of story
properties: Bet on whether someone completes their task
Bet on how rumors will spread
Bet on which version of story becomes "truth"
Can bet things other than money (reputation, favors, secrets)

- Public vs secret votes

- Votes that require quorum

- Help creates debt/obligation

modules.description:
Combining separate chains into one.

**Merge dynamics:**

- Voluntary vs forced mergers
- Equal vs absorption
- Temporary vs permanent
- Partial mergers
- Failed mergers create conflicts

modules.name: Split
modules.description:
Breaking chains into separate paths.

**Split causes:**

- Disagreements
- Resource limitations
- Strategic advantage
- Natural evolution
- Forced separation
- Splits can rejoin later

modules.name: Block
modules.description:
Preventing actions or chain progression.

**Blocking methods:**

- Physical blocking
- Legal/rule blocking
- Social pressure blocking
- Resource denial
- Information blocking
- Temporary vs permanent

modules.name: Bypass
modules.description:
Going around blocks or obstacles.

**Bypass strategies:**

- Alternative routes
- Exception exploitation
- Creating new paths
- Overwhelming blocks
- Waiting out blocks
- Cost of bypass

modules.name: Queue
modules.description:
Waiting in line for opportunity/resource.

**Queue dynamics:**

- Position matters
- Can lose place
- Can trade places
- Skip conditions
- Multiple queues
- Queue jumping penalties

modules.name: Reserve
modules.description:
Claiming future rights to something.

**Reservation systems:**

- Binding vs non-binding
- Reservation costs
- Transfer rights
- Cancellation penalties
- Overbooking possible
- Reservation chains

modules.name: Yield
modules.description:
Giving way to others.

**Yielding reasons:**

- Forced yielding
- Strategic yielding
- Temporary yielding
- Yielding creates obligation
- Refusing to yield consequences

modules.name: Persist
modules.description:
Continuing despite obstacles.

**Persistence effects:**

- Wears down opposition
- Costs accumulate
- Can become obsession
- Sometimes rewarded
- Sometimes punished
- Group persistence powerful

modules.name: Abandon
modules.description:
Giving up on chains/commitments.

**Abandonment consequences:**

- Penalties apply
- Reputation damage
- Resources lost
- Others affected
- Can't always return
- Strategic abandonment

modules.name: Reclaim
modules.description:
Taking back what was lost/given.

**Reclaiming challenges:**

- Proof of ownership
- Current possessor resistance
- Time limits
- Condition changes
- Reclaim conflicts
- Partial reclaiming

modules.name: Exchange
modules.description:
Trading one thing for another.

**Exchange complexities:**

- Unequal exchanges
- Delayed exchanges
- Chain exchanges (A→B→C→A)
- Forced exchanges
- Exchange rates fluctuate
- Failed exchanges

modules.name: Transform
modules.description:
(Expanded)

Changing something into something else.

**Transformation types:**

- Gradual vs instant
- Reversible vs permanent
- Partial vs complete
- Voluntary vs forced
- Predictable vs unexpected
-

modules.name: Combine
modules.description:
Putting things together for new result.

**Combination effects:**

- Some combinations explosive
- Order matters
- Can't be separated
- Failed combinations waste resources
- Secret combinations
- Comb

modules.name: Separate
modules.description:
Breaking apart combined things.

**Separation challenges:**

- Some things inseparable
- Damage during separation
- Requires special knowledge
- Creates multiple pieces
- Value changes

modules.name: Preserve
modules.description:
Keeping something from changing/degrading.

**Preservation methods:**

- Active maintenance
- Protective storage
- Documentation
- Tradition keeping
- Cost of preservation
- Preservation fails event

action_system.implementation: Each module is an action players can take in chains

distributed_infrastructure.implementation: Use these repos for commitment/penalty enforcement

chain_mechanics.implementation: Chains emerge from player actions, no forced endpoints

general_pattern.purpose: Progress Module - Every Way to Track Progress
How This Connects to Other Modules

code_templates.implementation: Working code to adapt for your system

Ranked Match Commitment:**

python

# Player queues for ranked
commitment = await system.create_commitment(

    commitment_type='ranked_match',
    terms={
        'duration': 3600,  # 1 hour max
        'requirements': ['complete_match', 'no_afk', 'no_disconnect']
